summary: I consider myself an ambitious, driven, reliable, multifaceted and multilingual (Global) Procurement Manager, with a broad experience across various industries in multinational companies, both in Direct and Indirect Procurement of goods and/or services. After some 13 years+ in Procurement roles, I strongly believe this is where I belong. Procurements role in the organization is where I can fully utilize both my personality, and my strengths, which are:  being empathic, goal oriented, realistic, customer focused, happily taking ownership and lead, strong in relationship building, keeping myself and others organized, strive for results, open to new knowledge and learning opportunities, and always look to create win/win situations.

profile_positions.description:

Below an example of typical tasks the buyer would perform:
•Managing purchase requisitions in SURF- ServiceNow platform
•Train business owners on purchase requisition system 
•SAP data entry - PO issuance    
•Vendor Set up
•Educating the business groups on the procurement policy and process
•Working with the accounting teams to resolve issues associated with POs
•Run detailed monthly reports for business owners
•Purchasing point of contact for the business 
•Contract management/legal liaison on the vendor contracts

In addition to the above, I have within this role focused on improving the quality of our contract templates, led the first official RFP for the EMEA region and created a standard set of training material to support new starters using the purchase requisition tool.

profile_positions.description:
In an international Sourcing & Procurement team, my role as Sourcing Analyst continuously exposed me to a broad variety of challenging and interesting tasks. Whilst supporting sourcing managers in their various projects- and thus the business directly-my role was shaped to fit the changing needs of the procurement organization resulting in my involvement in projects relating to implementation of enabling tools, as outlined below.

Tools and Systems
• Implementation of an (indirect)spend management tool
• SOP creation, together with third party vendor- outlining step by step of (indirect spend data extract) related processes  (data extraction from some 15 different ERP systems)
• Implementation /user acceptance/testing of vendor contract repository
• Training new starters on Spend tool and contract repository
• Continuous process improvement on the above mentioned systems and tools

Sourcing Projects
• Partaking in high profile/spend projects, providing additional support to Senior Sourcing managers in the RFP (A-Z) phases
• Creating baselines, various analyses and calculations based on business input or spend data
• Leading Mid scale projects (A-Z) in the Professional services category.

Contract Management
• Handling existing vendors contract renewals- renegotiations- SOW creation
• Direct liaison with legal on any contract, SLA, or NDA related matters
• New vendor agreements review, mark up, liaison with legal and negotiation with vendors.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Sinai Centrum is a Jewish organisation that focuses on helping people who suffer from various mental illnesses, of which some are a result of traumatic war experiences.
During parts of November and December I acted as a 'Buddy' to a lady who suffered from Schizophrenia.
I spent time with her listening to her life stories, helping her out in the kitchen, brought lunch and cooked for her. We also found a mutual interest in music and films, which was a subject we would spend hours discussing.

Having a genuine interest in people, this was a truly great experience to me,  which I would not hesitate to once again take on if given the opportunity.
